properties.areaDesc: Cleveland; Arkansas; Drew; Dallas; Jefferson; Bradley; Lincoln; Desha; Ouachita; Calhoun; Grant
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 10 at 3:33AM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for portions of central Arkansas, southeast
Arkansas, and southwest Arkansas, including the following
areas, in central Arkansas, Grant. In southeast Arkansas,
Arkansas, Bradley, Cleveland, Desha, Drew, Jefferson, and
Lincoln. In southwest Arkansas, Calhoun, Dallas, and Ouachita.

* Through Tuesday afternoon

* Showers and thunderstorms are anticipated over south and
southeast sections today through Tuesday. One to two inches of
rain can be expected through Tuesday in this area. With an
already saturated ground, flash flooding may occur where heavier
rain falls.

* Since vegetation is dormant, and not consuming much ground
water, runoff from heavy rain will be increased. This elevates
the concern for flash flooding. Also, rapid rises may occur on
creeks, small streams, and flashy rivers.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
